title: Vaiphei (1967) Genesis Portion
description: Vaiphei is a Sino-Tibetan language belonging to the Kuki-Chin linguistic subbranch of the Tibeto-Burman group of languages. It is spoken mainly in the Indian state of Manipur and minutely in Mizoram, Assam, Meghalaya, and Tripura. The dialect spoken in Manipur exhibits a least partial mutual intelligibility with the other Mizo/Kukish dialects of the area including Thadou, Hmar, Paite, Simte, Kom and Gangte languages.
provider: Bangalore: The Bible Society of India

language.name: Vaiphei
language.area: South Manipur, Churachandpur District, 30+ villages; Assam; Meghalaya; Tripura.
